intro: Cascabela peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian cascabela, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found in humid, lowland areas and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species in its native habitat.
